title: Saalhausen Hills
text:
The Saalhausen Hills () are a range of hills up to high in the <a href="Sauerland">Sauerland</a> region within the districts of <a href="Kreis%20Olpe">Olpe</a> and <a href="Hochsauerlandkreis">Hochsauerlandkreis</a> in the German state of <a href="North%20Rhine-Westphalia">North Rhine-Westphalia</a>. They are part of the <a href="Rhine%20Massif">Rhine Massif</a> and lie within the <a href="S%C3%BCder%20Uplands">Süder Uplands</a>.
The hills are named after the village of <a href="Saalhausen%20%28Lennestadt%29">Saalhausen</a>, part of the town of <a href="Lennestadt">Lennestadt</a>, which is located on the southern edge of this forested region.
Geography.
The Saalhausen Hills are part of the South Sauerland Rothaar foothills ("Südsauerländer Rothaarvorrückens"), which belong to the West Sauerland Uplands (geographical unit no. 336). The hills are clearly delineated in the south by the <a href="Lenne%20%28Ruhr%29">Lenne</a> and cover that part of the Sauerland between Lennestadt in the west and <a href="Schmallenberg">Schmallenberg</a> in the east. To the northwest are the foothills of the <a href="Lennegebirge">Lennegebirge</a>, to the southeast the <a href="Rothaargebirge">Rothaargebirge</a>, to the southwest other elements of the South Sauerland Rothaar foothills and to the northeast the <a href="Fredeburger%20Land">Fredeburger Land</a>. The hills, whose southwest and central areas fall within the <a href="Rothaargebirge%20Nature%20Park">Rothaargebirge Nature Park</a>, are located north of the upper <a href="Lenne%20%28Ruhr%29">Lenne valley</a>, southeast of the Elspebach and southwest of the upper course of the <a href="Wenne">Wenne</a>.
Hills.
The highest elevation in the Saalhausen Hills is the 687.7 m high Himberg. Other hills include the Auergang (684.1 m), Ösenberg (678.8 m), <a href="Hoher%20Lehnberg">Hoher Lehnberg</a> (668.8 m), Hoher Hagen (642.2 m), Jürgensberg (618.9 m), <a href="Beerenberg%20%28Sauerland%29">Beerenberg</a> (614.1 m), Haferhagen (611.4 m), Kuhhelle (602.6 m), Stöppelkopf (572.0 m) and Robecker Berg (528.0 m).
Tourism.
A section of the <a href="Homert%20Trail">Homert Trail</a> runs through the Saalhausen Hills over a pass between the Himberg and Hoher Lehnberg.
